tutorial.title: Gallery - Part 1
tutorial.descriptionContent: Ready to create an online gallery? In this segment, we'll lay the foundation, setting up a canvas to showcase captivating images in a harmonious layout.

executableContent.instructions:
Welcome to the **Gallery** project. You'll be constructing a visually appealing gallery of images.

But that's not all! Clicking on each cat's image will bring up a larger version of the image in a modal (a pop-up window).
This is a common feature on many websites, especially e-commerce platforms, news sites, and portfolios.

1. Start with the basic HTML structure, including `<!doctype html>`, `html`, `head`, and `body` tag.

Let's add a title. We'll also need to link to our JS and CSS files.

1. Add a title to the webpage inside the `head` tag.
2. Include a `title` tag with some text.
3. Add a link to the CSS file by adding `<link rel="stylesheet" href="style.css">`.
4. Add a link to the JS file by adding `  <script src="script.js"></script>`.

Every webpage benefits from a clear header that lets users know the topic of the page. We also need to create a container for our images.

1. Inside the `<body>` tags, add an `<h1>` tag with text of your liking.
2. After the `<h1>`, create a `div` with a class of `"gallery"`.

executableContent.instructions:
Within our gallery, we'll have entries for each element. We'll use cats as an example, but feel free to use whatever you like. Let's start by adding a title and image for the first cat.

1. Inside our container (the `div` with the class `"gallery"`, create a `div` with a class of `"item"`.
2. Inside the item, add an image of your liking. (Or use `https://mimo.app/i/whispurr.png`.)
3. Below the image, add an `<h2>` element and give it a title. (Or use `Whispurr` if you want to go with the cat example.)
4. If you wish to, you can also add a paragraph for a description of the image.

hints.title: Why use alt?
hints.content:
Using the alt attribute for images in HTML is best practice because it:
1. Improves accessibility by providing a textual description for visually impaired users using screen readers.
2. Enhances SEO by helping search engines understand the image content.
3. Ensures usability by displaying the alt text in case the image fails to load.

In essence, the alt attribute makes web content more inclusive, searchable, and user-friendly.

executableContent.instructions:
Flexbox is a modern layout model that allows items within a container to be dynamically arranged. Let's use it for our gallery.

1. Style the `.gallery` class to display its children in a flex layout by using `display: flex;`.
2. Center the items horizontally by using `justify-content`.
3. Allow the items to wrap to the next line if there's not enough space by setting `flex-wrap` to `wrap`.
4. Finally, define a `gap` of `20px`.

Images catch the eye! Let's give them some style and make our thumbnails grow slightly on hover.

1. Create a `.thumbnail` rule and set `transition: transform 0.3s;` to tell CSS to animate changes.
2. Create a `.thumbnail:hover` rule and add a transform property by coding `transform: scale(1.1);`.
